Element.Name: Specification identifier
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears. It enables the buyer to process the document in an appropriate way.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for this pre-award catalogue request document that allows referencing.

Attribute.Name: Catalogue version
Attribute.Description: The version number of this catalogue request

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: The date when the catalogue request was issued, format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Issue time
Element.Description: The time when the catalogue request was issued. Time shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: RECEIVER PARTY OR ECONOMIC OPERATOR
Element.Description: Any natural or legal person or public entity or group of such persons and/or entities, including any temporary association of undertakings, which offers the execution of works and/or a work, the supply of products or the provision of services on the market.

Element.Name: Receiver party/Economic operator electronic address identifier
Element.Description: Electronic address of the economic operator.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for receiver party electronic address

Element.Name: Receiver/Economic operator identifier
Element.Description: An identifier that identifies the receiver/economic operator, such as a legal registration identifier.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for receiver party identification

Element.Name: Receiver/Economic operator name
Element.Description: The name of the receiver/economic operator

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The common name of the city, town or village, where the address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: The subdivision of a country.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Element.Name: Receiver/Economic operators country of legal registration
Element.Description: The country where the economic operator is registered. Use the alpha-2 code as found in the codelist "ISO 3166"

Element.Name: Contact point
Element.Description: The contact point's name.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: An e-mail address for the contact point.

Element.Name: CONTRACTING BODY
Element.Description: The contracting authority or contracting entity who is buying supplies, services or public works using a tendering procedure as described in the applicable directive

Element.Name: Contracting body electronic address identifier
Element.Description: Electronic address of the contracting body.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for provider party electronic address

Element.Name: Contracting body identifier
Element.Description: The national identifier of a contracting body as it is legally registered (e.g. VAT identification, such as KBO).

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for provider party identification

Element.Name: Contracting body name
Element.Description: The name of the contracting body as it is registered.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The common name of the city, town or village, where the address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: The subdivision of a country.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Element.Name: Contracting body country of legal registration
Element.Description: The country where the contracting body is registered. Use the alpha-2 code as found in the codelist "ISO 3166"

Element.Name: Contact point
Element.Description: The contact point's name.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: An e-mail address for the contact point.

Element.Name: PREVIOUS REQUESTED CATALOGUE REFERENCE
Element.Description: A reference to a specific Catalogue request; used if the Catalogue Request is updated.

Element.Name: Previous catalogue request identifier
Element.Description: The catalogue request identifier for the updated catalogue request

Element.Name: Previous version identifier
Element.Description: The previous version of the catalogue request that is superseded by this version.

Element.Name: Call for tenders reference identifier
Element.Description: A reference to the call for tender as issued by the contracting body.

Element.Name: CATALOGUE REQUEST LINE
Element.Description: A line in a pre-award catalogue request specifying

Element.Name: Catalogue request item identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the catalogue request item being unique within pre-award catalogue request.

Element.Name: LINE DELIVERY PERIOD
Element.Description: The requested delivery period for this item request. If used, both start and end date must be present

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The requested delivery start date for the item. The date must be the same or earlier than the delivery end date. Format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The requested delivery end date for the item. The date must be the same, or later than the delivery start date. Format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Validity description code
Element.Description: Code to indicate preferred or alternative dates

Element.Name: REQUESTED ITEM LOCATION QUANTITY
Element.Description: Information on requested quantity, location and price for the item

Element.Name: Minimum quantity
Element.Description: The minimum quantity for this item request/location. To specify an exact quantity, use the same quantity in both minimum and maximum quantity.

Attribute.Name: Minimum quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the minimum quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Maximum quantity
Element.Description: The maximum quantity for this item request/location. To specify an exact quantity, use the same quantity in both minimum and maximum quantity.

Attribute.Name: Maximum quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the maximum quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: APPLICABLE SALES LOCATION
Element.Description: This element is used if there are specific locations requested for the item.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The common name of the city, town or village, where the address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: The subdivision of a country.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Element.Name: PRICE
Element.Description: To state both the minimum price and the total budget price (maximum price), repeat the requested item location quantity for each type

Element.Name: Price amount
Element.Description: The minimum price (ABG) or the maximum price (NE), according to the corresponding price type code

Element.Name: Price type code
Element.Description: A coded value for the type of price, minimum or maximum price.

Element.Name: Item request description
Element.Description: A description of the item request specifying the kind of item that is requested.
Element.Value: John Eddison need a samsung computer.

Element.Name: Item request name
Element.Description: A name for the item request, e.g., the kind of item that is requested.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: Identifier of a referenced document

Element.Name: Document description
Element.Description: Textual description of the document.

Element.Name: External document URI
Element.Description: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

Element.Name: Document digest
Element.Description: Digest of the document.
Element.Value: Includes all specifications of the item.

Element.Name: Document digest method code
Element.Description: Code that indicates the algorithm used to calculate the hash.

Element.Name: Document file name
Element.Description: The file name of the document.

Element.Name: COMMODITY CLASSIFICATION
Element.Description: A classification of this item according to a specific system for classifying commodities.

Element.Name: Item request classification code
Element.Description: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature

Attribute.Name: Item classification identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier

Attribute.Name: Item request classification name
Attribute.Description: The name of the classification for this item.

Element.Name: REQUESTED ITEM PROPERTY
Element.Description: This element is used to provide information on requested item properties.

Element.Name: Requested item property identifier
Element.Description: The identifier of an item property request. This identifier shall be used in the corresponding pre-award catalogue if sent.

Element.Name: Requested item property name
Element.Description: The name of the requested item property

Element.Name: Requested element code
Element.Description: Code to indicate a specific element to be returned in the Pre-award catalogue, the code consists of the business term identifier for the elements that can be requested. (Optional elements at line level)

Element.Name: Requested item property value
Element.Description: The value of the item property, expressed as text

Element.Name: Requested item property value quantity
Element.Description: The quantity of the requested item property.

Attribute.Name: Value quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Requested item property description
Element.Description: Free text description of the property

Element.Name: Requested item property relevance
Element.Description: Relevance of the requested property in the corresponding pre-award catalogue.

Element.Name: ITEM PROPERTY CLASSIFICATION
Element.Description: A classification of an item property according to a standardized property system.

Element.Name: Item property classification code
Element.Description: Code for the item property according to a property code system

Element.Name: Item property classification name
Element.Description: The name of the item property in the referenced classification system.

Element.Name: Item property classification relevance
Element.Description: States whether the property classification code is Optional (O), Forbidden (F), For evaluation (E).

Element.Name: Requested item property minimum value
Element.Description: The minimum value requested for this property,

Element.Name: Requested item property maximum value
Element.Description: The maximum value requested for this property

Element.Name: REQUESTED ITEM REQUIREMENT
Element.Description: A functional requirement on an item that is not related to a property of the item and has to be proven by a specification, label, test report or any other means of proof.

Element.Name: Item requirement identifier
Element.Description: A unique identifier of the item requirement that allows referencing the item requirement.

Element.Name: General item requirement
Element.Description: A general item requirement on superior level, that might contain specified requirements on sub level (ref. element "cbc:CertificateType").

Element.Name: Sub-functional item requirement
Element.Description: Amore specific item requirement based on the general item requirement from element "cbc:CertificateTypeCode".
Element.Value: Total energy consumption of the computer

Element.Name: Item Absolute or Award requirement
Element.Description: States whether the item are absolute or award required. Use codelist "Absolute or award criteria/requirement".

Element.Name: Issuer party name
Element.Description: The name of the issuer of the certificate, label or other means of proof

Element.Name: Item requirement attachment identifier
Element.Description: The identifier for the requested item requirement attachment.

Element.Name: Item accepted evidence type
Element.Description: Use one of the accepted evidence types from Procurement Directive art.44: Type 1 labelling (ISO 14024), Type 2 labelling (ISO 14021), Type 3 labelling (ISO 14025), Certification, Test report, or Other means of proof. Use codelist "Accepted evidence type".

Element.Name: Item requirement policy type
Element.Description: The allowed policy relevant requirements are green, social or innovative. Use codelist "Catalogue policy relevant requirement".

Element.Name: Item requirement reference
Element.Description: A reference to an external specification of the item requirement.
